memory-chunk-metadata.h

5#ifndef V8_HEAP_MEMORY_CHUNK_METADATA_H_
6#define V8_HEAP_MEMORY_CHUNK_METADATA_H_
7
8#include <bit>
9#include <type_traits>
10#include <unordered_map>
11
12#include "src/base/atomic-utils.h"
13#include "src/base/flags.h"
14#include "src/base/functional.h"
15#include "src/common/globals.h"
16#include "src/flags/flags.h"
17#include "src/heap/marking.h"
18#include "src/heap/memory-chunk-layout.h"
19#include "src/heap/memory-chunk.h"
20#include "src/objects/heap-object.h"
21#include "src/utils/allocation.h"
22
23namespace v8 {
24namespace internal {
25
26class BaseSpace;
27
28class MemoryChunkMetadata {
29 public:
30 // Only works if the pointer is in the first kPageSize of the MemoryChunk.
31 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunkMetadata* FromAddress(Address a);
32
33 // Only works if the object is in the first kPageSize of the MemoryChunk.
34 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunkMetadata* FromHeapObject(Tagged<HeapObject> o);
35
36 // Only works if the object is in the first kPageSize of the MemoryChunk.
37 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunkMetadata* FromHeapObject(
38 const HeapObjectLayout* o);
39
40 V8_INLINE static void UpdateHighWaterMark(Address mark);
41
42 MemoryChunkMetadata(Heap* heap, BaseSpace* space, size_t chunk_size,
43 Address area_start, Address area_end,
44 VirtualMemory reservation);
45 ~MemoryChunkMetadata();
46
47 Address ChunkAddress() const { return Chunk()->address(); }
48 Address MetadataAddress() const { return reinterpret_cast<Address>(this); }
49
50 // Returns the offset of a given address to this page.
51 inline size_t Offset(Address a) const { return Chunk()->Offset(a); }
52
53 size_t size() const { return size_; }
54 void set_size(size_t size) { size_ = size; }
55
56 Address area_start() const { return area_start_; }
57
58 Address area_end() const { return area_end_; }
59 void set_area_end(Address area_end) { area_end_ = area_end; }
60
61 size_t area_size() const {
62 return static_cast<size_t>(area_end() - area_start());
63 }
64
65 Heap* heap() const {
66 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(heap_);
67 return heap_;
68 }
69
70 // Gets the chunk's owner or null if the space has been detached.
71 BaseSpace* owner() const { return owner_; }
72 void set_owner(BaseSpace* space) { owner_ = space; }
73
74 bool InSharedSpace() const;
75 bool InTrustedSpace() const;
76
77 bool IsWritable() const {
78 // If this is a read-only space chunk but heap_ is non-null, it has not yet
79 // been sealed and can be written to.
80 return !Chunk()->InReadOnlySpace() || heap_ != nullptr;
81 }
82
83 bool Contains(Address addr) const {
84 return addr >= area_start() && addr < area_end();
85 }
86
87 // Checks whether |addr| can be a limit of addresses in this page. It's a
88 // limit if it's in the page, or if it's just after the last byte of the page.
89 bool ContainsLimit(Address addr) const {
90 return addr >= area_start() && addr <= area_end();
91 }
92
93 size_t wasted_memory() const { return wasted_memory_; }
94 void add_wasted_memory(size_t waste) { wasted_memory_ += waste; }
95 size_t allocated_bytes() const { return allocated_bytes_; }
96
97 Address HighWaterMark() const { return ChunkAddress() + high_water_mark_; }
98
99 VirtualMemory* reserved_memory() { return &reservation_; }
100
101 void ResetAllocationStatistics() {
102 allocated_bytes_ = area_size();
103 wasted_memory_ = 0;
104 }
105
106 void IncreaseAllocatedBytes(size_t bytes) {
107 DCHECK_LE(bytes, area_size());
108 allocated_bytes_ += bytes;
109 }
110
111 void DecreaseAllocatedBytes(size_t bytes) {
112 DCHECK_LE(bytes, area_size());
113 DCHECK_GE(allocated_bytes(), bytes);
114 allocated_bytes_ -= bytes;
115 }
116
117 MemoryChunk* Chunk() { return MemoryChunk::FromAddress(area_start()); }
118 const MemoryChunk* Chunk() const {
119 return MemoryChunk::FromAddress(area_start());
120 }
121
122 protected:
123 // If the chunk needs to remember its memory reservation, it is stored here.
124 VirtualMemory reservation_;
125
126 // Byte allocated on the page, which includes all objects on the page and the
127 // linear allocation area.
128 size_t allocated_bytes_;
129 // Freed memory that was not added to the free list.
130 size_t wasted_memory_ = 0;
131
132 // Assuming the initial allocation on a page is sequential, count highest
133 // number of bytes ever allocated on the page.
134 std::atomic<intptr_t> high_water_mark_;
135
136 // Overall size of the chunk, including the header and guards.
137 size_t size_;
138
139 Address area_end_;
140
141 // TODO(sroettger): the following fields are accessed most often (AFAICT) and
142 // are moved to the end to occupy the same cache line as the slot set array.
143 // Without this change, there was a 0.5% performance impact after cache line
144 // aligning the metadata on x64 (before, the metadata started at offset 0x10).
145 // After reordering, the impact is still 0.1%/0.2% on jetstream2/speedometer3,
146 // so there should be some more optimization potential here.
147
148 Heap* heap_;
149
150 // Start and end of allocatable memory on this chunk.
151 Address area_start_;
152
153 // The space owning this memory chunk.
154 std::atomic<BaseSpace*> owner_;
155
156#ifdef THREAD_SANITIZER
157 // Perform a dummy acquire load to tell TSAN that there is no data race in
158 // mark-bit initialization. See MutablePageMetadata::Initialize for the
159 // corresponding release store.
160 void SynchronizedHeapLoad() const;
161 void SynchronizedHeapStore();
162 friend class MemoryChunk;
163#endif
164
165 friend class BasicMemoryChunkValidator;
166 friend class ConcurrentMarkingState;
167 friend class MarkingState;
168 friend class AtomicMarkingState;
169 friend class NonAtomicMarkingState;
170 friend class MemoryAllocator;
171 friend class PagedSpace;
172};
173
174} // namespace internal
175
176namespace base {
177
178// Define special hash function for chunk pointers, to be used with std data
179// structures, e.g.
180// std::unordered_set<MemoryChunkMetadata*, base::hash<MemoryChunkMetadata*>
181// This hash function discards the trailing zero bits (chunk alignment).
182// Notice that, when pointer compression is enabled, it also discards the
183// cage base.
184template <>
185struct hash<const i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {
186 V8_INLINE size_t
187 operator()(const i::MemoryChunkMetadata* chunk_metadata) const {
188 return hash<const i::MemoryChunk*>()(chunk_metadata->Chunk());
189 }
190};
191
192template <>
193struct hash<i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {
194 V8_INLINE size_t operator()(i::MemoryChunkMetadata* chunk_metadata) const {
195 return hash<const i::MemoryChunkMetadata*>()(chunk_metadata);
196 }
197};
198
199} // namespace base
200} // namespace v8
201
202#endif // V8_HEAP_MEMORY_CHUNK_METADATA_H_
